reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Investing for impact against Tuberculosis and HIV

description.narrative: Haiti - TB/HIV. This program has the following goals: Mettre fin à l’épidémie de tuberculose d'ici à 2035 / Ending the tuberculosis epidemic by 2035. Maitriser et stopper la progression de l’épidémie de VIH au sein de la population haïtienne par des interventions de qualité qui respectent les droits et la dignité humaine / To control and halt the progression of the HIV epidemic in the Haitian population through quality interventions that respect human rights and dignity. The objectives of this program are: Réduire la mortalité due à la tuberculose de 18/100 000 en 2015 à 6/100 000 d’ici 2021 / Reduce tuberculosis mortality from 18/100,000 in 2015 to 6/100,000 by 2021. Réduire l’incidence de la tuberculose de 200/100 000 en 2015 à 165/100 000 d’ici à 2021 / Reduce TB incidence from 200/100,000 in 2015 to 165/100,000 by 2021. Faire en sorte qu’aucune famille touchée ne supporte de coûts catastrophiques liés à la tuberculose / To ensure that no affected family suffers catastrophic TB-related costs. Les nouvelles infections sont réduites de 90% dans la population générale et dans les groupes cibles prioritaires d’ici à 2023 / New infections are reduced by 90% in the general population and in priority target groups by 2023. D’ici à fin 2023, le taux de survie à 12 mois des enfants et adultes traités par ARV atteint 90% / By the end of 2023, the 12-month survival rate of children and adults treated with ARVs reaches 90%. D’ici à fin 2023, dans un environnement légal défini et favorable aux droits des PVVIH, la stigmatisation et la discrimination des PVVIH et des populations clés a baissé de 80% / By the end of 2023, in a defined legal environment that is supportive of the rights of PLHIV, stigma and discrimination against PLHIV and key populations has been reduced by 80%. 100% des populations dans les zones touchées ont accès à un diagnostic précoce soutenu par un programme d’assurance qualité et ont accès à un traitement efficace sans délai / 100% of populations in affected areas have access to early diagnosis supported by a quality assurance programme and have access to effective treatment without delay

description.narrative: Living support to client/ target population (LSCTP)

title.narrative: Impact indicator for HTI-C-WV
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Outcome indicator for HTI-C-WV
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

Percentage of people living with HIV not on ART at the end of the reporting period among people living with HIV who were either on ART at the end of the last reporting period or newly initiated on ART during the reporting period
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Coverage / Output indicator for HTI-C-WV
Percentage of HIV-positive results among the total HIV tests performed during the reporting period
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/ high risk groups (other than prisoners)
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of people newly diagnosed with HIV initiated on ART
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
Percentage of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among prisoners
Percentage of children (under 15) on ART among all children living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of adults (15 and above) on ART among all adults living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
